page.title: 01Bourton-on-the-Water
page.content: Bourton-on-the-Water, Gloucestershire, is situated to the east of the A429 (Fosseway) and is a delightful{ {Cotswold stone village,}popular with tourists. The{River Windrush}flows through the main street and is bordered by a wide green and shaded by trees. The small villages of{Wyck {Rissington}and{Little Rissington}are situated on a spring line at the foot of a steep slope east of the Windrush and Dikler valleys. The surrounding area is mostly farmland, mainly down to pasture. North of Bourton there is some evidence of the Kingham to Cheltenham railway track, closed in 1961. There are also traces of{Roman} and{Saxon settlement}in the area. Bourton now depends upon tourism for its livelihood though the majority of its inhabitants are either retired or commute to work in neighbouring towns.
